{{Infobox Weapon |name=3,7cm KPÚV vz. 37 |image=[[File:Škoda 37 mm Model 1937 side.jpg|300px]] |caption=Škoda 37 mm vz. 1937 on display at [[Belgrade]]'s [[Military Museum (Belgrade)|Military Museum]] |origin=Czechoslovakia |type=[[Anti-tank gun]] |is_ranged=yes |is_artillery=yes |is_vehicle= |service= |used_by=Czechoslovakia
Nazi Germany
Yugoslavia
[[Slovak Republic (1939–1945)|Slovakia]] |wars=[[World War II]] |designer= Škoda |design_date=1935–1936 |manufacturer=[[Skoda Works|Škoda Works]] |production_date=1936–1939 |number= |variants= |weight={{convert|370|kg|lb|abbr=on|sigfig=1}} |length= |width= |height= |part_length={{convert|1.77|m|ftin|abbr=on|sigfig=1}} L/47.8 |crew=? |cartridge= |caliber={{convert|37.2|mm|in|abbr=on}} |action= |rate=12 rounds per minute |velocity={{convert|750|m/s|ft/s|abbr=on|sigfig=1}} |range= {{convert|900|m|yd|abbr=on|sigfig=1}} |max_range= |feed= |sights= |breech=semi-automatic vertical sliding block |recoil= |carriage=split trail |elevation=-8° to +26° |traverse=50° |diameter= |filling= |filling_weight= |detonation= |yield= }} The '''3,7 cm KPÚV vz. 37''' ({{lang-cs|kanón proti útočné vozbě}}) was an [[anti-tank gun]] produced by the [[Skoda Works|Škoda Works]] that saw service in [[World War II]]. Originally designed for the Czechoslovak Army, some were also sold to Yugoslavia. A number were appropriated by the Germans after [[German occupation of Czechoslovakia]] in 1939 and used under the designations '''3,7 cm PaK 37 (t)'''. Captured Yugoslav guns were used under the designation of '''3,7 cm Pak 156 (j)'''. [[Slovak Republic (1939–1945)|Slovakia]] acquired 158 when it declared independence from Czechoslovakia in March 1939.Kliment and Nakládal, p. 121 The gun had a small shield and wooden-spoked wheels, although some were fitted with pneumatic wheels. ==Notes== ==References== * Gander, Terry and Chamberlain, Peter. ''Weapons of the Third Reich: An Encyclopedic Survey of All Small Arms, Artillery and Special Weapons of the German Land Forces 1939-1945''. New York: Doubleday, 1979 ISBN 0-385-15090-3 * {{cite book|last=Kliment|first=Charles K.|author2=Nakládal, Bretislav|title=Germany's First Ally: Armed Forces of the Slovak State 1939—1945|publisher=Schiffer|location=Atglen, PA|year=1997|isbn=0-7643-0589-1}} {{commons|Škoda 37 mm Model 1937}} {{Weapons of Czechoslovakia}} {{DEFAULTSORT:3,7cm KPUV vz. 37}} [[Category:World War II anti-tank guns]] [[Category:37 mm artillery]] [[Category:Artillery of Czechoslovakia]] {{WWII-stub}} {{artillery-stub}}
